properties.areaDesc: Mountains Of San Benito County And Interior Monterey County Including Pinnacles National Park; Southern Salinas Valley/Arroyo Seco and Lake San Antonio; Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest
properties.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 3 at 3:42AM PST until February 5 at 9:00AM PST by NWS San Francisco CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Subfreezing temperatures expected both Monday night and
Tuesday night. Overnight lows forecast in the mid 20s.

* WHERE...Southern Salinas Valley, Arroyo Seco, Lake San Antonio,
the Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest, the
Mountains Of San Benito County and Interior Monterey County
Including Pinnacles National Park.

* WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from Midnight tonight to 9 AM
PST Tuesday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Tuesday night
through Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Freeze conditions can kill crops and other sensitive
vegetation, and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
properties.instruction:
Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should
be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have
in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-
ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

NWSheadline: FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM PST TUESDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
